bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, August 2, 1923

div1.p: Russell sends Carter copies of three letters written by Hideyo Noguchi regarding yellow fever vaccine and serum, and post mortem findings on a suspected yellow fever death.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, August 2, 1923

August 2, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am enclosing copy of a letter from Doctor
Noguchi dated July 30, giving his comments upon the re-
ports received from Grand Bassam and Segou (Sudan) re-
garding the use of yellow fever vaccine and serum.

I am enclosing also copies of two letters enclosure 2 enclosure 3 from
Doctor Noguchi dated July 31, regarding the letter from
Doctor Pettman of May 25 with enclosures, and the letter
from Doctor Connal transmitting post mortem microscopic
findings in the case of the Italian Bradenelli.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Doctor H. R. Carter
Crozet
Virginia
